alert.note: Alert for Orange County Coastal; San Diego County Coastal Areas (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued February 22 at 2:01AM PST until February 23 at 3:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 6 to 10 feet with sets up to 14 feet. Highest surf in southern San Diego County. * WHERE...Beaches of San Diego and Orange Counties. * WHEN...Through 3 AM Thursday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and beach erosion. Coastal flooding is possible during high tide this morning at around 1015 AM. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The combination of the strong winds, high surf and a strong storm surge may result in flooding on beach parking lots and boardwalks during this morning`s high tide.
info.instruction: Swimming and surfing in these dangerous conditions is discouraged.

area.areaDesc: Orange County Coastal; San Diego County Coastal Areas
